intro: Quinaria, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Quinaria is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its berries are toxic to humans and animals, making it an important plant to avoid in certain regions.
